newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek depos flat, FRNs firm in late dealings.
newsitem.headline: Greek depos flat, FRNs firm in late dealings.

text.p: Greek floating rate notes moved up on Tuesday while deposits and forex forwards held steady in late trading, dealers said.
"Floating rate notes of January 28 maturing in 2004 showed some trading activity with their rates moving lower," said a dealer at a state bank.
But interbank deposits and forex forwards were stagnant, with interest rates remaining constant and nothing exciting happening, dealers said.
The mark was quoted at 156.20/30 drachmas from Tuesday's 156.530 fix, the dollar at 265.03/13 drachmas from 266.540 and the Ecu at 304.10/20 from 304.070 drachmas.
"Ecu/drachma is slightly up around 304.13/18," said a forex dealer.
The National Bank of Greece, the domestic money market's biggest player, quoted the following late rates:
